media:group.media:title: Mozrov: A Village Without Children
media:group.media:description:
In the village of Mozrov in the Vayots Dzor Province, there are no children. There are also no stores, no schools, no hospitals, no paved roads, and no irrigation water. There is also a lack of hope that these things ever will be. In this mostly abandoned village, however, there are still people who have stories to tell.

media:group.media:title: Gyumri‚Äôs election circus explained
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian examines Armenia‚Äôs recent parliamentary motion supporting EU membership, considering its symbolic value, political realities, and the misleading narratives surrounding it. He also analyzes Sunday‚Äôs mayoral election in Gyumri, Armenia‚Äôs second-largest city, critiquing the dysfunction of local politics and the potential implications for next year‚Äôs national election.

entry.title: Two Armenian generals charged with negligence

media:group.media:title: Two Armenian generals charged with negligence
media:group.media:description:
üìç A criminal case has been initiated against Vardan Ghukasyan, former mayor of Gyumri and the Communist Party‚Äôs candidate in the local elections, based on an alleged audio recording, Armenia‚Äôs Prosecutor General‚Äôs Office confirmed today. üìç Two Armenian army generals were charged with official negligence, and prosecutors seek to recover $11.5 million in damages from them. üìç Major aid cut for Karabakh refugees comes into effect: https://www.civilnet.am/en/news/825894/major-aid-cut-for-karabakh-refugees-comes-into-effect/

entry.title: What's it like as a Turk in Armenia? #shorts

media:group.media:title: What's it like as a Turk in Armenia? #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Mustafa Aydin, a professor of international relations at Kadir Has University is in Yerevan to participate in a conference organized by the Caucasus Institute entitled ‚ÄúGathering Storm: Regional Security of the South Caucasus in the Context of the Crisis of the Global Order.‚Äù He speaks with CivilNet about Turkey‚Äôs evolving role amid global and regional upheavals, as well as the country‚Äôs positioning between the Russia-Ukraine war and conflicts in the Middle East. The discussion focuses on how Turkey views the South Caucasus and, in particular, normalization attempts with Armenia. Aydin emphasizes the importance of people-to-people contact between Turks and Armenians to debunk myths they hold about each other and increase mutual understanding.
